snippet: Engineers, archaeologists and historians tried to uncover the World War II escape tunnels to replicate the ingenuity of the Royal Air Force fliers. They were partly successful.
abstract: British-based engineers, archaeologists and historians try to uncover the World War II escape tunnels, chronicled in the 1963 movie The Great Escape, to replicate the ingenuity of the Royal Air Force fliers who built them in what was then Hitler's Germany; team is stunned that, even without the menace of Nazi camp guards, they are unable to match their wartime counterparts' most crucial skills.
lead_paragraph: Engineers, archaeologists and historians tried to uncover the World War II escape tunnels to replicate the ingenuity of the Royal Air Force fliers. They were partly successful.

headline.seo: At ‘Great Escape’ Site, Tunnel Is Excavated by Modern Engineers
headline.main: Latter-Day Dig of ‘Great Escape’ Tunnels Humbles Modern Engineers
headline.print_headline: Latter-Day Dig of ‘Great Escape’ Tunnels Humbles Modern Engineers
